item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Is Tor still safe to use? (214 points | 150 comments)
2. Why wordfreq will not be updated (1122 points | 346 comments)
3. Cloudflare misidentifies Hetzner IPs as being located in Iran (20 points | 8 comments)
4. Moshi: A speech-text foundation model for real time dialogue (124 points | 20 comments)
5. Qwen2.5: A Party of Foundation Models (85 points | 13 comments)
6. Meticulous (YC S21) is hiring to eliminate UI tests ( | hide)
7. 0day Contest for End-of-Life Devices Announced (160 points | 81 comments)
8. Bento: Jupyter Notebooks at Meta (135 points | 58 comments)
9. Llama 3.1 Omni Model (66 points | 5 comments)
10. Microplastics in the Olfactory Bulb of the Human Brain (78 points | 62 comments)
11. A high-performance, zero-overhead, extensible Python compiler using LLVM (112 points | 29 comments)
12. iOS 18 breaks IMAPS self-signed certs (22 points | 27 comments)
13. OpenTelemetry and vendor neutrality: how to build an observability strategy (22 points | 4 comments)
14. Show HN: I made crowdwave – imagine Twitter/Reddit but every post is a voicemail (42 points | 21 comments)
15. OpenAI Threatening to Ban Users for Asking Strawberry About Its Reasoning (167 points | 116 comments)
16. LinkedIn is now using everyone's content to train their AI tool (50 points | 17 comments)
17. Holding a Program in One's Head (2007) (53 points | 30 comments)
18. RabbitMQ 4.0 Released (159 points | 62 comments)
19. Gentle Guide to Self-Hosting (206 points | 87 comments)
20. Meta AI: "The Future of AI Is Open Source and Decentralized" (119 points | 62 comments)
21. The Dune Shell (139 points | 41 comments)
22. A overview of binaries, ELF, and NoMMU on Linux (29 points | discuss)
23. Apple mobile processors are now made in America by TSMC (1407 points | 686 comments)
24. Senate Vote Tomorrow Could Give Helping Hand to Patent Trolls (106 points | 21 comments)
25. Launch HN: Cerebrium (YC W22) – Serverless Infrastructure Platform for ML/AI (34 points | 20 comments)
26. Papermill: Parameterizing, executing, and analyzing Jupyter Notebooks (75 points | 54 comments)
27. Knowledge graphs using Ollama and Embeddings to answer and visualizing queries (66 points | 7 comments)
28. IBM is quietly axing jobs, source says (27 points | 13 comments)
29. GM electric vehicles can now access Tesla Superchargers (81 points | 48 comments)
30. Valkey 8.0.0 Is Out (90 points | 24 comments)
